line: Parsr: Turn your documents into data!
label: heading

line: P arsr allows a data scientist, an analyst, a developer, or an enthusiast to automatically obtain
label: paragraph

line: structured data from a compiled PDF or an image or scanned document. It is a minimal-footprint
label: paragraph

line: document cleaning, parsing and extraction toolchain which generates readily available, organized
label: paragraph

line: and usable data for data scientists and developers.
label: paragraph

line: C urrently, Parsr has (but is not limited to) the following features:
label: paragraph

line: Text Order Detection
label: paragraph

line: Page Number Detection
label: paragraph

line: Header-Footer Detection
label: paragraph

line: Table Detection and Reconstruction
label: paragraph

line: Named Entity Recognition (Dates, Percentages, etc)
label: paragraph

line: Key-Value Pair Detection (for the extraction of specific form-based entries)
label: paragraph

line: Link Detection
label: paragraph

line: Heading Detection
label: paragraph

line: Document Hierarchy Regeneration (Words, Lines and Paragraphs)
label: paragraph

line: Whitespace Removal, etc
label: paragraph

line: F urthermore, the pipeline is extensible and one’s own module can be easily introduced.
label: paragraph

line: Parsr’s pipeline’s backbone is based on Typescript, but it can easily be extended using modules
label: paragraph

line: plugging into tools built from flavors like Python or Haskell.
label: paragraph

line: P arsr supports a choice among multiple extraction engines for each type of input. Parsr extracts
label: paragraph

line: textual data from PDF files using pdftojson and from images using OCR adapters such as tesseract.
label: paragraph

line: The user even has the choice to use the proprietary ABBYY FineReader solution for using a
label: paragraph

line: professional grade OCR as the backend for enhanced text recognition precision.
label: paragraph

line: P arsr provides users with clean, structured and label-enriched information set. The output
label: paragraph

line: (formatted as a friendly, documented JSON file) can possibly contain data with fine granularity
label: paragraph

line: (bounding boxes for each letter of each word), to relatively low frequency details like the sizes and
label: paragraph

line: margins of each page.
label: paragraph

line: The user can also generate outputs in the formats of Markdown, Raw Text, PDF, CSV (for tabular
label: paragraph

line: data), and others. New output formats can also be easily generated using an extensible output
label: paragraph

line: module system for easy extensibility.
label: paragraph

line: T he Parsr toolchain’s open-source dependency set is minimal: node.js, qpdf, mupdf-tools,
label: paragraph

line: imagemagick, tesseract, pdf2json, pandoc and camelot. An optional proprietary dependency ABBYY
label: paragraph

line: FineReader is equally supported.
label: paragraph

line: T he ready-to-use applications range from data entry and document analysis automation, archival,
label: paragraph

line: and many others.
label: paragraph

line: Furthermore, it is free and open source!
label: paragraph

line: Parsr was built by the community using community-made tools for the community itself. Delve right
label: paragraph

line: in; check it out and help improve this version 0.1 making Parsr the standard for data extraction from
label: paragraph

line: documents!
label: paragraph

line: Internal
label: paragraph
